description:
The OpenStack Compute Administration Manual is inconsistent in it's use of the "-y" flag with apt-get. This is best evidenced here:

http://docs.openstack.org/diablo/openstack-compute/admin/content/installing-the-cloud-controller.html

As this is intended as a guide for new users to OpenStack (who may also be new to Ubuntu), I would recommend removing the "-y" flag from all of these commands. Alternatively, if there is a specific command that requires it, I would recommend identifying why the flag is required for that set of packages.
title: inconsistency in documentation when using -y flag on install commands

comments.content:
The OpenStack Compute Administration Manual is inconsistent in it's use of the "-y" flag with apt-get. This is best evidenced here:

http://docs.openstack.org/diablo/openstack-compute/admin/content/installing-the-cloud-controller.html

As this is intended as a guide for new users to OpenStack (who may also be new to Ubuntu), I would recommend removing the "-y" flag from all of these commands. Alternatively, if there is a specific command that requires it, I would recommend identifying why the flag is required for that set of packages.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jacob-walcik
